SENT.plain: Neurogenic claudication is most frequently observed in patients with degenerative lumbar spinal stenosis
We describe a patient with lumbar epidural varices secondary to obstruction of the inferior vena cava by pathological lymph nodes presenting with this syndrome
Following a diagnosis of follicular lymphoma, successful chemotherapy led to the resolution of the varices and the symptoms of neurogenic claudication
The lumbar epidural venous plexus may have an important role in the pathogenesis of spinal stenosis
Although rare, epidural venous engorgement can induce neurogenic claudication without spinal stenosis
Further investigations should be directed at identifying an underlying cause
